name: Jord
title: Jord - Norse Mythology
subtitle: Goddess of the Earth
shortDescription: The personification of Earth itself, mother of Thor by Odin . Jord represents the primal earth, the ground beneath all things, and the source of strength and stability.
longDescription: Jord is one of Odin 's many consorts, and from their union came Thor , the mightiest warrior of the gods. Her identity as Earth itself connects Thor to the land and its people - he is literally born of earth and sky ( Odin being associated with the heavens). Little else is recorded about Jord in the surviving texts, but her importance as Thor 's mother makes her a significant figure in the divine genealogy.

sections.title: Mythology
sections.content: Jord is one of Odin 's many consorts, and from their union came Thor , the mightiest warrior of the gods. Her identity as Earth itself connects Thor to the land and its people - he is literally born of earth and sky ( Odin being associated with the heavens). Little else is recorded about Jord in the surviving texts, but her importance as Thor 's mother makes her a significant figure in the divine genealogy.

relatedConcepts.name: üåç EARTH MOTHER
relatedConcepts.description: Jord embodies the Earth Mother archetype - the primordial earth personified as a goddess, source of life, stability, and the foundation upon which all things rest.
